content.description: Source: United States Office of Personnel Management, 2016.
content.question: Which of the following explains an action Congress can take that would have the most influence on the data on the graphs?

choices.label: Members of Congress can increase congressional salaries, but only for the next Congress.
Congress can pass legislation that influences the federal salary structure.
Congress can cut funding for federal programs, which would lead to a decrease in salaries.
Congress can enforce a regulation that addresses wage increases.

content.answer: Congress can pass legislation that influences the federal salary structure.
